comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Pools 0 is related to connection problem. What pool do you mine?Do you have a stable internet connection?Would you mind to check if your miner is set to DHCP mode if it is set to DHCP mode try to switch to static and set the IP with the current IP of your miner then add DNS you can either use google DNS or Cloudflare.I guess that the pool you are trying to mine is blocked by your ISP.Also, take note that this miner does not work in the Nicehash pool so try to switch to another pool.

comments.author: Rodemi
comments.body: Like BitMaxz said, check your internet settings and pool settings and reboot. Here is a troubleshooting guide for the 1246.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: CoZmo73 on January 25, 2023, 09:20:44 PMHi there,Does your browser show you the charts? (piecharts and linecharts) Not mine.If so, what browser are you using and what firmware is installed?I thought your problem is solved. Anyway, have you tried my suggestion from my previous posts in your thread? If it didn't work and the problem is still there make sure that you always do a factory reset every time you flash the unit. And actually, you have a different unit but try to change your network settings from DHCP to static using the same IP but this time add DNS(Google DNS or Cloudflare DNS) maybe the Pie chart is not built-in but requesting data somewhere online.

comments.author: MinerMetrix
comments.body: It seems what you may have installed is a regular 1246 (A3201) control board with N-type (A3200) hash boards, or your control board is faulty. But, your control board is not oem due to the hash rate designation missing in Ver. Also, since your ATAOPTS1 is null and your ATABD0/1/2 are also null this indicates that it is an first-run, new control board. To check your control board (log attribute): Core[A320x]. To check your hash boards: There is a designation written on the top front right edge of each hash board will be something like "MMv3_*_3200". Or, if your BUSS bar connectors on the hash boards only have 1 side and not 2 indicates you have A3200 hash boards. Also, your ASIC booster will have much bigger capacitors with the A3200's. The fact that the BOOTBY indicates restart by API (automated or reboot command entered), there are no error codes, no connection problems, in high-performance mode, alive pools, not idling, and none of your ASICs are overheating, indicates all your components are good just not compatible.My recommendation: Check and make sure your control board and your hash boards are compatible; then allow the aging process to complete (log when completed: ADJ[2] BAR[100%]. Manual restart of the miner is required.) ***Note: If the unit goes back into aging-mode after completion then you haven't fixed the compatibility issue, or you may need to use a Linux CLI to enter commands. The 'diagnose' tool that comes with FMS is way to slow and the unit will restart before the other 2 commands can be entered.

comments.author: MinerMetrix
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on January 05, 2023, 06:22:32 PMPools 0 is related to connection problem. What pool do you mine?Do you have a stable internet connection?Would you mind to check if your miner is set to DHCP mode if it is set to DHCP mode try to switch to static and set the IP with the current IP of your miner then add DNS you can either use google DNS or Cloudflare.I guess that the pool you are trying to mine is blocked by your ISP.Also, take note that this miner does not work in the Nicehash pool so try to switch to another pool.POOL[0] indicates the pool is connected and alive. Also, if SoftOFF = 3 && POOLS = 1 && PING = 0 then you may have dead pools or a faulty ethernet port/cable and/or a bad wiznet chip.

comments.author: Alex Bozhko
comments.body: If you have a problem with the Internet connection on your Avalon 1246 Mineer, there are a few steps you can take to try and resolve the issue.1. Check the Ethernet cable connection: Make sure that the Ethernet cable is properly connected to the miner and your router or switch. Try connecting another device to the same port to make sure the problem is not related to the port.2. Check your network settings: Make sure that the network settings on the miner are correct and match your local network. Check that the device is receiving an IP address and subnet mask. If necessary, change the network settings and reboot the miner.3. Reboot the miner: Try rebooting the miner to fix possible software issues.4. Update the firmware: Check that you have the latest version of firmware installed on the miner. If not, update the firmware to the latest version.5. Contact the manufacturer: If you are unable to resolve your Internet connection problem, please contact the manufacturer of the Avalon 1246 Miner for assistance. They can help you diagnose the problem and find a solution.6. In general, Internet connection problems on Avalon 1246 Miner can be caused by a variety of reasons, from hardware issues to network configuration issues. However, by following the steps above, you increase your chances of solving the problem and restoring your Avalon 1246 Miner Internet connection.

comments.body: IMO you have a loose contact. (check plug on switch/router and Avalon MM board and cabel)QuoteNETFAIL[82 92 0 0 0 0 0 0]Pool 0 disconnecting time is 82 sec and resuming time is 92 sec you also should try another pool
